tool.name: ROIPACImport

param.name: in_raster
param.dialogReference:
Input raster.

If the input is a two-band raster (unw.tif), If the input has two bands, the interferogram is assumed to be in the second band (Band_2). (This is the normal output from the ROIPAC workflow.) See the Usage in this tool's help for instructions to create the required unw.tif file using ENVI from ROIPAC output.

param.name: out_raster
param.dialogReference: Output raster with values of line-of-sight (LOS) displacement in cm.

param.name: platform
param.dialogReference:
ALOS - use wavelength of 23.62 cm

ENVISAT - use wavelength of 5.66 cm

param.name: rscfile
param.dialogReference:
This is the image rsc file that defines the spatial reference (lat long extent) of the input. The spatial reference is assumed to be geographic WGS84.

The name of this file is most likely: geo_date-date.unw.rsc (example: geo_090203-100206.unw.rsc)

If the input raster is already georeferenced, this parameter will be disabled.

tool.summary:
This tool converts an unwrapped phase displacement interferogram raster (in radians) to cm units.

  • You can symbolize the output raster using the Raster Ranger tool.

  • You can add multiple line of sight (LOS) displacement (cm) rasters together using the Cell Statistics tool or the Raster Calculator tool.
tool.usage:
Creating the input from this tool from ROIPAC output in ENVI

1. (In ENVI) Add the unwrapped image geo_date-date.unw to ENVI with File > Open As > Generic Formats > Binary. In the dialog provide these values from the input raster .unw.rsc file.

This raster has two bands, Band_1 (radar magnitude) and Band_2 (interferogram in radians).

  • Samples: WIDTH

  • Lines: FILE_LENGTH

  • Bands: 2

  • Data Type: Floating point

  • Interleave: BIL

2. Select the image layer on the layer list, select from the menu: File> Save As >Save As ... (ENVI, NITF, TIFF, DTED). Click OK to accept defaults for the first dialog, in the next dialog specify TIFF format , enter 0 for the Ignore Data value, and specify output image location ending with "unw.tif".

3. The output image is the input to this tool.

dataIdInfo.idAbs:
This tool converts an unwrapped phase displacement interferogram raster (in radians) to cm units.

  • You can symbolize the output raster using the Raster Ranger tool.

  • You can add multiple line of sight (LOS) displacement (cm) rasters together using the Cell Statistics tool or the Raster Calculator tool.
